member.name: T:MassTransit.NewId
member.summary: A NewId is a type that fits into the same space as a Guid/Uuid/unique identifier, but is guaranteed to be both unique and ordered, assuming it is generated using a single instance of the generator for each network address used.

member.name: M:MassTransit.NewId.#ctor(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Creates a NewId using the specified byte array.

member.name: M:MassTransit.NewId.Next(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of NewIds to generate

member.name: M:MassTransit.NewId.Next(MassTransit.NewId[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: The starting offset for the newly generated ids
The number of NewIds to generate

member.name: M:MassTransit.NewId.NextGuid
member.summary: Generate a NewId, and return it as a Guid
